text.0: he only is the sea holder of treasures born many a time he views the hearts within us.
text.1: he hides him in the secret couples bosom the bird dwells in the middle of the fountain.
text.2: inhabiting one dwellingplace in common strong stallions and the mares have come together.
text.3: the sages guard the seat of holy order and keep the highest names concealed within them.
text.4: the holy pair of wondrous power have coupled they formed the infant they who bred produced him.
text.5: the central point of all that moves and moves not the while they wove the sages thread with insight.
text.6: for tracks of order and refreshing viands attend from ancient times the goodly infant.
text.7: wearing him as a mantle earth and heaven grow strong by food of pleasant drink and fatness.
text.8: he calling loudly to the seven red sisters hath skilled in sweet drink brought them to be looked on.
text.9: he born of old in middle air hath halted and sought and found the covering robe of pūṣan.
text.10: seven are the pathways which the wise have fashioned to one of these may come the troubled mortal.
text.11: he standeth in the dwelling of the highest a pillar on sure ground where paths are parted.
text.12: not being being in the highest heaven in aditis bosom and in dakṣas birthplace.
text.13: is agni our firstborn of holy order the milchcow and the bull in lifes beginning.
